contentrichtext.text: '''Yevgeny Sudbin''' ({{lang-ru|Евгений Судьбин}}, born 1980, [[Saint Petersburg]], [[Russia]]) is a [[Russia]]n [[concert pianist]]. He studied at the [[Saint Petersburg Conservatory|St. Petersburg Conservatory]]. After his family emigrated to Berlin when he was age 10, he won several German piano competitions,<ref name="Church">{{cite news | author=Michael Church | title=Preview: Prom 10: Yevgeny Sudbin, Royal Albert Hall, London | url=http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/preview-prom-10-yevgeny-sudbin-royal-albert-hall-london-875667.html | work=The Independent | date=24 July 2008 | accessdate=2008-07-26}}</ref> and studied at the [[Hochschule für Musik Hanns Eisler]] in [[Berlin]]. He was a pupil of [[Christopher Elton]] at the [[Purcell School]] and the [[Royal Academy of Music]], for nine years.<ref name="Thompson">{{cite news | author=Damian Thompson | title=From Russia, with fingers of steel | url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2005/12/29/bmsub29.xml&sSheet=/arts/2005/12/29/ixtop.html/ | work=Telegraph | date=29 December 2005 | accessdate=2007-11-28}}</ref> His education has also included lessons with [[Murray Perahia]], [[Claude Frank]], [[Leon Fleisher]], [[Stephen Kovacevich]], [[Dmitri Bashkirov]], [[Fou Ts'ong]], [[Stephen Hough]], [[Alexander Satz]], and [[Maria Curcio]]. Sudbin has recorded music of [[Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky|Tchaikovsky]], [[Sergei Rachmaninov|Rachmaninov]], [[Nikolai Medtner|Medtner]], [[Domenico Scarlatti|Scarlatti]], and [[Alexander Scriabin|Scriabin]] for the [[BIS Records|BIS]] label.<ref name="Thompson"/><ref>{{cite news | author=Geoffrey Norris | title=Classical CDs | url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2007/11/24/bmclascds124.xml | work=Telegraph | date=24 November 2007 | accessdate=2008-07-26}}</ref> Sudbin has lived in the UK since 1997. He made his debut at [[The Proms]] in July 2008.<ref>{{cite news | author=Geoffrey Norris | title=BBC Proms 2008: Sudbin sublime, support subdued suppo orchestra | url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2008/07/25/bmprom125.xml | work=Telegraph | date=25 July 2008 | accessdate=2008-07-26}}</ref> That same month, Sudbin and his fiancée Sally Wei married in Italy.<ref>{{cite news | author=Geoffrey Norris | title= Yevgeny Sudbin: concerto for a stag night | url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2008/07/24/bmsudbin124.xml | work=Telegraph | date=24 July 2008 | accessdate=2008-07-26}}</ref> In September 2010 he was appointed visiting professor of piano at the [[Royal Academy of Music]] in London.<ref name="New Appointments">{{cite web | author= | title=New Appointments| url=http://www.ram.ac.uk/whatsnew/Pages/Newappointments.aspx| publisher=Royal Academy of Music | date= | accessdate=2 October 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.yevgenysudbin.com/ Yevgeny Sudbin Official Website] * [http://www.notesontheroad.com/yevgeny-sudbin.html Virtuoso Pianist Yevgeny Sudbin on Safari, Eggs Benedict and The Soloist Life] {{Authority control|VIAF=31771320}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Sudbin, Yevgeny | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Russian pianist | DATE OF BIRTH = 1980 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sudbin, Yevgeny}} [[Category:Russian classical pianists]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1980 births]] [[Category:Alumni of the Royal Academy of Music]] [[Category:Hochschule für Musik "Hanns Eisler" alumni]] [[Category:Russian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:People educated at Purcell School]] {{Russia-classical-pianist-stub}}
